title: (x) Looking for a square grotesk typeface - FF Hydra {Yves}
content:
I'm looking for a square, bold, san-serifed typeface. Similar to like a bold trade gothic, but not as vertical.

Does anybody have any suggestions as to what will fit this description?

sorry, but i have no visual (it's really something that i want. i know i've seen it before but i don't remember where).
author: Kenny Bania

comments.content: FF Hydra all the way, Kenny. It has killer ink traps and comes in three widths -- [FF Hydra](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211119/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FF.11346.0.0) (narrowest), [FF Hydra Extended](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211119/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FF.11347.0.0) and [FF Hydra Text](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211119/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FF.11463.0.0) (widest). Everyone I recommend it to falls head over heels for it.

These sort of fit that description:

Charter Oak  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/charter-oak/](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211119/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/charter-oak/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/charter-oak/")

Antique Sans  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/antique-sans/](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211119/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/antique-sans/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/antique-sans/")

Serpentine (not strictly a sans-serif, but often used like one)  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/serpentine/](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211119/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/serpentine/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/serpentine/")

Helvetica Inserat  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/helvetica-inserat/](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211119/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/helvetica-inserat/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/helvetica-inserat/")

Gusto Black  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bagraphics/gusto/](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211119/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bagraphics/gusto/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bagraphics/gusto/")

OL Newsbytes  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ortizlopez/olnewsbytes/](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211119/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ortizlopez/olnewsbytes/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ortizlopez/olnewsbytes/")

Black Grotesk  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/blackgroteskatt/](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211119/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/blackgroteskatt/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/blackgroteskatt/")

Largo  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/largo/](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211119/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/largo/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/largo/")

And, of course, Impact  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ascender/impact/](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211119/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ascender/impact/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ascender/impact/")

David Thometz

[This](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211119/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/cerulean-nf/) face, based on an old Barnhart Brother & Spindler face called Lining Gothic No. 71, isn't quite as square, but it's decidely less vertical than Trade Gothic Bold.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211119im_/http:/typophile.com/files/cerulean_5819.gif)

Hi Kenny. Plenty of good suggestions here already, but I think you're talking about the bolder weights of [Eurostile](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211119/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=Eurostile) or even [Microgramma.](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211119/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=Microgramma)

I would like to announce the quite brandnew [Morris Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211119/http:/www.linotype.com/184368/morrissans-family.html) by Dan Reynolds. Familiar in style but surprisingly fresh in lowercases.

thanks guys for all the input.

the FF Hydra Text is definitely looking sweet. i can't believe how closed the apertures are, but it's pretty much bang on as to what i was looking for.

as always, thanks again for all the input and the speedy replies.

and on a side note, what typeface is used for TYPOPHILE in the logo? is that a customized font or is it commercially available?
